result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott G Willecke

records.addlTxt: Plea date on November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:05 PM Defendant Scott G Willecke in court.  Attorney Eric R Pangburn in court for Scott G Willecke.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over for further proceedings.  Arraignment held. Defendant waives the reading of the Information. Not guilty plea entered to the charge(s) contained in the Information. Defendant waives right to substitution.  States offer to be given to defense/defendant by  June 17, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling conference on August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 098654,
Payable Number: 155663,
Receipt Number: 22R 006564,
Amount: $20.00
RE:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 04-20-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping and possess THC .  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-09-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
